Title: Studying Just-In-Time Defect Prediction using Cross-Project Models
UseOF-SZZ: To know whether or not a change introduces a defect
Summary:
Study approaches for constructing Just-In-Time (JIT) defect prediction models that identify source code changes 
    that have a high risk of introducing a defect.
Outcome:
while JIT models rarely perform well in a cross-project context, their performance tends to improve
    when using some kind of approaches. Their findings empirically confirm that JIT models learned using other projects 
    are a viable solution for projects with limited historical data. However, JIT models tend to perform best in a cross-project context when the
    data used to learn them are carefully selected
